elements.title: Jäñgir-Kerei Khan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jäñgir-Kerei Khan (pictured) was responsible for establishing the first school, settlement, hospital, and museum in the Bukey Horde?

elements.title: British 1st Division (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the British 1st Division repulsed numerous French assaults at the Battle of Waterloo including the final main assault?

elements.title: Nick Acocella (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that New Jersey politics expert Nick Acocella hosted Pasta & Politics, a television show where he would make pasta with various politicians including Thomas Kean, Cory Booker, and Chris Christie?

elements.title: Kerr-Addison Mine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Kerr-Addison Mine was the largest producer of gold in North America in 1960?

elements.title: Lee Winter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as a young adult, lesbian novelist Lee Winter disliked the poor quality of lesbian fiction, preferring autobiographies by lesbian people?

elements.title: 2004 Nosratabad fuel tanker explosion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2004 Nosratabad fuel tanker explosion highlighted the high rate of road accidents in Iran, one of the worst globally?

elements.title: Walt Nauta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Walt Nauta would bring a Diet Coke to the Oval Office whenever President Donald Trump requested one via his call button?

elements.title: Little Witch Nobeta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one critic called Little Witch Nobeta a "Baby's First Dark Souls"?
